content: {'id': '8be5c11a-c76f-37cf-978e-291d5208fe6a', 'contentType': 'STORY', 'title': 'India revokes grid access for 17 GW of clean energy projects, says source', 'description': '', 'summary': 'NEW DELHI (Reuters) -India has cancelled grid access for nearly 17 gigawatts (GW) of delayed clean energy projects to prioritise connections for those that are operational or nearing completion, according to a source familiar with the matter and official documents reviewed by Reuters.  The state-run Central Transmission Utility of India Ltd (CTUIL) informed companies including Adani Green Energy, ReNew Power, NTPC, Avaada Group, JSW Energy, and ACME Solar about the cancellations, the documents show.  The affected projects are located in renewable-rich states such as Rajasthan, western Gujarat, and Madhya Pradesh in central India, according to a document from the federal agency overseeing inter-state transmission access.', 'pubDate': '2025-09-08T08:02:04Z', 'displayTime': '2025-09-08T08:02:04Z', 'isHosted': True, 'bypassModal': False, 'previewUrl': None, 'thumbnail': {'originalUrl': 'https://media.zenfs.com/en/reuters.com/5f6c50d1e6e06ac863ded626d03ada63', 'originalWidth': 800, 'originalHeight': 533, 'caption': 'FILE PHOTO: A view of power-generating windmill turbines at a wind park of Adani Green Energy at Ahmedabad-Narayan Sarovar state highway near Nakhatrana village in the western state of Gujarat, India, November 29, 2024. REUTERS/Amit Dave/FIle Photo', 'resolutions': [{'url': 'https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/ba1Ka04B4xO2V5NfAjwE9g--~B/aD01MzM7dz04MDA7YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b24-/https://media.zenfs.com/en/reuters.com/5f6c50d1e6e06ac863ded626d03ada63', 'width': 800, 'height': 533, 'tag': 'original'}, {'url': 'https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/5czGiZtn28lw3Et9ID2W4w--~B/Zmk9c3RyaW07aD0xMjg7dz0xNzA7YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b24-/https://media.zenfs.com/en/reuters.com/5f6c50d1e6e06ac863ded626d03ada63', 'width': 170, 'height': 128, 'tag': '170x128'}]}, 'provider': {'displayName': 'Reuters', 'url': 'https://www.reuters.com/'}, 'canonicalUrl': {'url': 'https://sg.finance.yahoo.com/news/india-revokes-grid-access-17-080204448.html', 'site': 'finance', 'region': 'SG', 'lang': 'en-SG'}, 'clickThroughUrl': {'url': 'https://finance.yahoo.com/news/india-revokes-grid-access-17-080204448.html', 'site': 'finance', 'region': 'US', 'lang': 'en-US'}, 'metadata': {'editorsPick': False}, 'finance': {'premiumFinance': {'isPremiumNews': False, 'isPremiumFreeNews': False}}, 'storyline': None}

content: {'id': '0c588e2a-d014-330b-ab66-c2a5a1fe1592', 'contentType': 'STORY', 'title': "India's Adani Green Energy posts quarterly profit jump on strong power sales", 'description': '', 'summary': "BENGALURU (Reuters) -India's Adani Green Energy reported a 31% jump in first-quarter profit on Monday, driven by an increase in power sales and higher capacity utilisation, sending shares up 3.5%.
